result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity:  Arraingment

01:12 PM Defendant Kendal William Tilley in court by video with attorney Joshua Patrick Grube by video.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.

Activity: Preliminary Hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:32 AM Defendant Kendal William Tilley in court in person with attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in person. David Zarwell appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Austin Harter sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. Court takes notice of DOT's certified driving record regarding Defendants record. State moves for bind over, Defense objects with argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
Preliminary hearing on May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Maintain absolute sobriety and no driving during the pendency of this case.   Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
